Video.Text: Here's a video to help you create daily routines with your children.

Set of messages 1.Message: Daily routines, such as time for schoolwork, play, meals, and sleep, can help our children feel safe and secure. They also give our children a sense of security.

List of tips.Message: Here are 4 simple tips that you can use when establishing routines with your children:

Option 1: Give one instruction at a time.Message: 1. Help your younger children learn routines by taking them through the activity step by step. Give one instruction at a time. Praise them each time they follow!

Option 2: Use transition warnings to hel.Message: 2. Transition warnings can also be very helpful. They give your child some time to prepare for the next activity: "In 5 minutes it will be time to pack up the toys before bedtime…"

Option 3: Create regular eating and slee.Message 1: 3. Regular eating and sleeping times are especially important for babies. Not enough sleep can make your child cranky, irritable, and short tempered.
Option 3: Create regular eating and slee.Message 2:
Here are some tips for how to help your child prepare for bedtime:

• Try to have regular bedtimes each day as much as possible.
• Try to make it quiet and the lights in the room dim. 
• Spend some time with your child. You can sing a lullaby or tell a calm story.
• Give your child a hug and kiss goodnight before leaving the room.

Option 4: Involve your teen in creating.Message: 4. Involve your teen in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. Let them plan when they do schoolwork and when they can relax!
